title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

items.title: Some Maryland parents want the Supreme Court to let them pull their kids from elementary school classes if story time features gay characters
items.description: Montgomery County public schools introduced the storybooks as part of an effort to better reflect the district's diverse population.

items.title: IMF Expects Trump’s Tariffs Will Slow Global Economic Growth
items.description: The International Monetary Fund expects slower growth and higher inflation in the U.S. as a result of President Trump’s trade policies.

items.title: ESPN host Shannon Sharpe will continue his on-air duties despite getting hit with $50 million lawsuit accusing him of rape
items.description: Sharpe is accused of verbal abuse, violence, making threats, and recording sexual encounters without consent.

items.title: Greenland Navigates the New World Order
items.description: Whom Greenlanders choose to do business with — economically, politically and socially — will tell us a lot about the coming global realignment.

items.title: U.S. Bank shares tribute on earnings call to executive Terry Dolan who died in Minnesota plane crash
items.description: Dolan was remembered as an "outstanding businessman and wonderful person."

items.title: Tesla’s Falling Profit May Pressure Elon Musk to Return to Day Job

items.title: Uber is launching a shuttle bus service at the Atlanta airport
items.description: Expansion follows successful roll-out in NYC.

items.title: Can Harvard Withstand Trump’s Financial Attack?

items.title: Russia and Ukraine, Under Trump Pressure, Signal Openness to Direct Talks
items.description: An unusual public back-and-forth suggested that both sides in the war were eager to at least appear interested in negotiations.

items.title: As Big Oil producers start exploring again, the Gulf of Mexico is making a comeback with new projects from Chevron, Shell and BP
items.description: New technologies and cost savings are unlocking Big Oil projects in the Gulf

items.title: ‘Francis Was Deeply Loved’: Gazans Mourn Death of Pope
items.description: Gaza’s Christians paid their respects to Pope Francis, who called in on a local church almost daily to check on them throughout the war.

items.title: Russia and Ukraine, Under Trump Pressure, Signal Openness to Direct Talks
items.description: An unusual public back-and-forth suggested that both sides in the war were eager to at least appear interested in negotiations.
